about.title: About
about.label: About Me
about.p1: I started my journey in tech not with a computer science degree, but with a need to rebuild. After facing significant personal challenges, I dedicated myself to learning how to build. What followed was a year of intense, focused work.
about.p2: Today, I specialize in building full‑stack AI applications for the European market, with a deep understanding of the logistical and regulatory challenges (GDPR, SGB XI) that matter here. My work on Hausheld, a complete workflow system for a 200‑employee home‑help service in NRW, is a testament to my ability to turn a complex, real‑world 'logistical nightmare' into a clean, production‑ready digital platform.
about.p3: I don't just write code. I build systems that work for people.

hausheldPage.title: Hausheld
hausheldPage.tagline: Home-help workflow platform for NRW — scheduling, GPS-verified check-in/out, digital signatures, and Entlastungsbetrag tracking. Built with data integrity and EU/GDPR in mind.
hausheldPage.problemText: A 200-employee home-help service in NRW faced manual paper schedules, proof of service on paper, and strict regulatory requirements (GDPR, SGB XI) for health data and billing.
hausheldPage.solutionText: A distributed ecosystem: one FastAPI backend (PostgreSQL + PostGIS), a Next.js PWA for field workers (schedule, GPS check-in/out, client signatures), and a Vite+React admin dashboard (calendar, sick leave, substitute suggestions, budget alerts, SGB XI CSV export, audit log). PostGIS powers distance-based substitute suggestions; a strict shift state machine and append-only audit log support compliance.
hausheldPage.featureMobilePWA: Workers see their schedule, check in/out with GPS, capture client signatures (Leistungsnachweis).
hausheldPage.featureAdmin: Calendar, sick leave, substitute suggestions, client budget alerts, SGB XI CSV export, audit log.
hausheldPage.featureSubstitution: Suggests up to 3 replacement workers by distance (PostGIS) and weekly capacity.
hausheldPage.featureBudget: Per-client monthly budget, 15% alert threshold, CSV export for insurance (SGB XI).
hausheldPage.featureAudit: Append-only log of every access to client (health) data; read-only API.
hausheldPage.architectureIntro: Hausheld is a distributed ecosystem: one API, two frontends. All mutations go through the backend with JWT and role-based access (Admin vs Worker).
hausheldPage.backendDesc: Single source of truth. FastAPI, SQLAlchemy 2 (async), PostgreSQL + PostGIS, Alembic. Enforces RBAC, encrypts health data, writes to the audit log.
hausheldPage.mobileDesc: Next.js PWA (German UI). Schedule, check-in/out, signature pad, client list for assigned shifts.
hausheldPage.adminDesc: Vite + React. Calendar (FullCalendar), workers & sick leave, clients & budget alerts, billing export, audit log, substitute assignment.
hausheldPage.dataFlow: Data flow is unidirectional: frontends only call the API; no direct DB access from the client.
hausheldPage.techBackend: FastAPI, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, SQLAlchemy 2, Alembic, Pydantic — API, auth, substitutions, budget, audit, SGB XI export
hausheldPage.techFrontend: Next.js, Tailwind, PWA — Mobile worker app
hausheldPage.techAdmin: Vite, React, Tailwind, FullCalendar — Desktop admin
hausheldPage.geospatialIntro: PostgreSQL/PostGIS powers distance-based substitute suggestions when a shift is unassigned (e.g. worker on sick leave).
hausheldPage.geospatialBullet1: Worker and Client models store a PostGIS point (WGS84): current_location and address_location.
hausheldPage.geospatialBullet2: Endpoint: GET /shifts/{id}/suggest-substitutes (Admin only). Ranks candidates by ST_Distance (client ↔ worker), excludes overlapping shifts and workers over weekly contract_hours.
hausheldPage.geospatialBullet3: Result: Up to 3 workers with distance (m) and remaining capacity; admin assigns with one click.
hausheldPage.gdprEncryption: Fernet (AES) for insurance_number and care_level; key via ENCRYPTION_KEY (not in DB).
hausheldPage.gdprAudit: Append-only audit_logs: user, action, target, timestamp. Read-only API — no tampering.
hausheldPage.gdprSoftDeletes: Workers, clients, shifts: only deleted_at set; rows kept for audit/legal hold.
hausheldPage.gdprResidency: Designed for AWS eu-central-1 (Frankfurt); health data stays in Germany.
hausheldPage.shiftIntro: Shifts follow a strict state machine; GPS and signatures provide verifiable proof of service.
hausheldPage.shiftInProgress: Worker has checked in (GPS + timestamp stored).
hausheldPage.shiftCompleted: Worker has checked out (GPS + client signature); cost set for budget deduction.
hausheldPage.shiftUnassigned: No worker (e.g. sick leave); admin can use suggest-substitutes and assign.
hausheldPage.shiftTransitions: Scheduled → (check-in) → In_Progress → (check-out + signature) → Completed. GPS-verified check-in/out replaces paper forms for insurers and audits.
hausheldPage.disclaimer: This project is for portfolio and educational use. Production use requires legal, data-protection, and insurance advice. See GDPR_COMPLIANCE.md.
